If your using win 7 64 bit ultimate, on the eset forums there is a lot of posts about people having issues. Mainly, the computer won't boot after installing v5 of ess. The eset guy there is saying it seems to happen more often than not if you install the program on any drive other than the system drive where you installed win7, which is usually C.

There's a  smattering of people who say putting it on C fixes it, some say it doesn't. Some 32 bit win7 ultimates are having issues also....

So once again, heads up, try at your own risk. This is an eset issue, and not an issue with this share. Thanks scene4all for providing us with a version that doesn't need a new key every few days.

Anyone having issues with invalid username/password try this

-open nod32
-click on setup on the left
-click on "enter advanced setup" on the right
-click on the + sign on the left of "update"
-click on the submenu "update"
-click on "setup" on the right
-under update tab make sure "never update program components" and "never restart computer" is ticked the click on OK

No links... No spam... just info.

This helped me: "ESET SMART SECURITY 5 2012 INSTALL ROLLBACK (rolling back premature) FIX: Windows 7:

Step1:type in start menu search - edit group policy
Step2:In local group policy editor, expand administrative templates
Step3:Expand windows components
Step4:Click windows installer near the bottom of windows components
Step5: Doubleclick prohibit rollback, enable, restart pc.
Step6: If you haven't uninstalled, Run this in safe mode[URL="http://download.eset.com/special/ESETUninstaller.exe"]http://download.eset.com/special/ESETUninstaller.exe[/URL] - boot in safe mode by pressing f8 many times at startup and boot in safe mode. and then delete the folder @ C:\Program Files\ESET, then type in start menu folder options, click the view tab, click show hidden folders, press ok. Then delete C:\ProgramData\ESET. Restart.
Step7:Install with the offline installer [URL="http://www.eset.com/me/download/home/detail/family/5/"]http://www.eset.com/me/download/home/detail/family/5/[/URL] Choose options or just run it
Step8: (Activate your product, for example in safe mode)
Step9:Step1,2,3,4,Doubleclick prohibit rollback, select not configured. Restart
Step10:UPDATE ESET (when you connect to internet, choose home network)"
